item.title: RBI Guv Malhotra asks staff to emphasise customer centricity in NY message - Business Standard
item.description:
RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra's New Year Message: Emphasize Customer Centricity

Date: 2025-01-01 | Source: Business Standard

In his New Year message to RBI employees, Governor Sanjay Malhotra stressed the importance of customer centricity in their endeavors for 2025, an 'exciting and challenging' year ahead.

  1. Malhotra asked staff to focus on providing seamless and user-friendly services.
  2. The Indian rupee depreciated nearly 3% in 2024, touching an all-time low, and has been under pressure for the last three months.
  3. Economic growth slowed, with GDP growth in Q2 at 5.4%, and retail inflation fell to 5.5%.
  4. Malhotra will chair his first MPC meeting in February, with the policy repo rate unchanged at 6.5% for nearly two years.
“Let us keep customer centricity at the heart of our endeavours and work towards providing seamless and user-friendly services.” – Sanjay Malhotra, RBI Governor

Malhotra took charge in December 2024, succeeding Shaktikanta Das, and highlighted the RBI's achievements in 2024, including enhancing customer protection, promoting financial literacy, and encouraging innovation.

item.title: Honda Elevate Dark Edition exposed in leaked photo: Stunning Black aesthetic shines - Mint
item.description:
Honda Elevate Dark Edition Leaked

Published on: January 16, 2023 - Source: Live Mint

The all-new Honda Elevate Dark Edition has been leaked, showcasing a stunning all-black exterior and distinctive Dark Edition badging, appealing to the growing preference for stealthy designs among Indian buyers.

  1. Expected to feature an all-black interior with bespoke Dark Edition badges.
  2. Likely to offer higher-end variants with climate control, connected car tech, and level-2 ADAS.
  3. Powered by a 1.5L i-VTEC petrol engine with a 6-speed manual or CVT option.
  4. To rival similar offerings like Kia Seltos X-Line, Skoda Kushaq Monte Carlo, and MG Astor Black Storm.
  5. Potential launch details to be announced during the 2025 Bharat Mobility Expo media days on January 17.
Although interior images have not surfaced, it is anticipated that the cabin will mirror the dark theme with an all-black interior.

Honda currently offers the Elevate in seven monotone and three dual-tone color combinations. The Dark Edition is expected to command a price premium over standard variants.

item.title: Stocks to Watch on January 2: Tata Motors, NMDC, RailTel Corporation, Indian Bank and more - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Stocks to Watch on January 2: Tata Motors, NMDC, RailTel Corporation, Indian Bank and more

Date: January 2, 2025

Source: CNBC TV18

On January 2, key stocks to observe include Tata Motors, NMDC, RailTel Corporation, and Indian Bank, among others.

  • NMDC: Reported a 5.1% YoY increase in iron ore production for December 2024, totaling 4.71 million tonnes.
  • RailTel Corporation: Awarded a work order worth ₹78.43 crore by Bharat Coking Coal Ltd.
  • Indian Bank: CEO Shanti Lal Jain retired on December 31, 2024.
  • Goa Carbon: Resumed operations at its Bilaspur unit, normalizing production as of January 1, 2025.
  • Tata Motors: Recorded a 1% YoY increase in domestic sales, reaching 76,599 units in December 2024.
“This is to inform that RailTel Corporation of India Ltd has received the work order from Bharat Coking Coal Limited for Works amounting to Rs. 78,43,30,164 (Including Tax).”

The ongoing trends in these stocks reflect significant changes and updates that investors should monitor closely.

item.title: December GST collections rise 7.3% YoY to Rs 1.77 lakh crore - Moneycontrol
item.description:
December GST collections rise 7.3% YoY to Rs 1.77 lakh crore

Date: January 01, 2025 Source: Moneycontrol

Goods and Services Tax collections rose to Rs 1.77 lakh crore in December, maintaining a level above Rs 1.7 lakh crore for the tenth consecutive month.

  • GST collections increased by 7.3% compared to Rs 1.65 lakh crore in December 2023.
  • Collections were below the Rs 2.1 lakh crore mark reached in April of the previous year.
  • The growth rate of 7.3% is the slowest pace observed in three months.
“India's recent GST collections have slowed down slightly, which is typical after the holiday season. It’s well in line with expectations as we have been witnessing slight decrease in consumer spending over past few months,” said Saurabh Agarwal, Tax Partner, EY India.

Overall, the data suggests a need for monitoring consumer spending trends in the upcoming months to understand potential impacts on future GST collections.

item.title: Reliance Power stock hits 5% upper circuit after subsidiary Sasan Power repays $150 million debt | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Reliance Power Stock Soars After $150 Million Debt Repayment by Sasan Power

Date: January 1, 2025 - Source: Live Mint

Reliance Power share price rallied over 5 percent following a significant debt repayment by its subsidiary Sasan Power Limited.

  • On December 31, 2024, Sasan Power made a bullet payment of $150 million to IIFCL, UK, fulfilling its debt obligations.
  • The share price increased to ₹44.68, up from ₹42.56, with a market capitalization of ₹17,947 crore.
  • A total of 33.63 lakh shares were traded, resulting in a turnover of ₹14.89 crore.
  • This repayment is expected to enhance Sasan Power’s liquidity and credit rating.
  • Sasan Power operates the world’s largest integrated coal-based power plant in Madhya Pradesh.
  • Reliance Power aims to shift focus towards the renewable energy sector for future growth.
“This repayment will bolster Sasan Power’s debt coverage metrics, improve liquidity, and enhance its credit rating.”

In conclusion, the successful repayment strengthens Reliance Power's financial standing, positioning it well for future opportunities in renewable energy.

item.title: IRFC Share Price: Check make-or-break level for darling railway stock - Target 2025 - ET Now
item.description:
IRFC Share Price: Check make-or-break level for darling railway stock - Target 2025

Updated: January 1, 2025 | Source: ET NOW

After a strong rally in 2024, IRFC shares experienced profit booking, leading to a 49% gain for the year. The stock is currently trading at a 35% discount from its 52-week high, and investors are keenly watching its performance as the Union Budget approaches.

  • IRFC shares experienced a strong performance but faced profit booking.
  • The stock has support at Rs 144 and resistance at Rs 153.
  • Long term outlook remains strong, with a potential upward move towards Rs 170-175 if certain levels are crossed.
  • IRFC has yielded impressive returns of 362% over the last two years.
“I have two suggestions for IRFC investors - if the view is long, then HOLD the position and if the view is short, then maintain a stop loss at Rs 144,” said Kunal Parar of Choice Equity.

In conclusion, while IRFC's outlook is solid, investors should be mindful of stop-loss levels as the stock is experiencing sideways movements.

item.title: Stock Split: 1st-ever by TOP NBFC; record date next week - ET Now
item.description:
Stock Split: 1st-ever by TOP NBFC; record date next week

Updated: January 1, 2025 16:47 IST | Source: ET NOW

Shriram Finance Ltd, a leading NBFC, has announced its first-ever stock split, with a record date set for January 10, 2025.

  • The stock split will occur in a 5:1 ratio, lowering the face value from Rs 10 to Rs 2.
  • Shareholders must hold the stock on January 10 to benefit from the split.
  • Shriram Finance's shares closed at Rs 2,916.75 prior to the split announcement.
  • The stock split aims to boost liquidity and make shares more affordable for investors.
  • Shriram Finance has delivered a 42% return over the last year and 111% over the last two years.
"Fixed Friday, January 10, 2025 as the Record Date for determining entitlement of Equity Shareholders for the purpose of Sub-division/Split of face value of Equity Shares of the company."

The move is expected to enhance liquidity and attract more small investors into the stock.

item.description:
Top Stock Gainers and Losers on 1 January, 2025

Date & Source: January 1, 2025, Live Mint

On 1 January, 2025, the markets witnessed a mixed performance with Nifty closing at 23,644.8, up 0.41%, and Sensex closing at 78,139.01, up 0.47%.

  • Top Gainers in Nifty: Maruti Suzuki India (up 3.22%), Mahindra & Mahindra (up 2.49%), Larsen & Toubro (up 1.66%), Bajaj Finance (up 1.65%), Eicher Motors (up 1.31%)
  • Top Losers in Nifty: Hindalco Industries (down 1.58%), Dr. Reddy's Laboratories (down 1.40%), Adani Ports & Special Economic Zone (down 1.01%), Oil & Natural Gas Corporation (down 0.96%), Tata Steel (down 0.95%)

item.title: Stock market holiday calendar for 2025: BSE, NSE to remain shut on these 14 days - The Economic Times
item.description:
Indian Stock Market Holidays in 2025: BSE & NSE to Shut on 14 Days

Date & Source: Published on Dec 31, 2024, The Economic Times

Introduction: Indian stock exchanges, the BSE and NSE, will observe 14 holidays in 2025, including festivals like Mahashivratri, Holi, Id-Ul-Fitr, and Diwali. Trading remains unaffected by public holidays falling on weekends.

  1. BSE and NSE will shut for one day each in February, May, November, and December.
  2. March and August will have two market closures each.
  3. April and October will have three holidays each.
  4. The first market closure is on February 26 for Mahashivratri.
  5. The market will remain open on February 1, Budget Day.
  6. Muhurat Trading will be held on October 21 during Diwali.

Also read: Sensex & Nifty in 2025: Predictions, targets, must-have stocks for the new year

Conclusion: Investors and market participants should note these trading holidays to manage their trading activities efficiently. The detailed holiday calendar is available on the official websites of the BSE and NSE.

item.title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO Day 2 Live Updates: Issue subscribed 42 times so far. Check GMP, other details. Apply or not? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO Day 2

Date & Source: January 1, 2025, Livemint

Indo Farm Equipment IPO has entered its second day of bidding, with the issue subscribed over 46 times so far. The tractor manufacturer aims to raise ₹260.15 crore from its book-built issue. The price band has been set at ₹204 to ₹215 per share.

  1. The issue was subscribed 46.80 times so far on the second day of the book-building process.
  2. The global agriculture equipment market is projected to grow at a CAGR of 7.3% during the forecast period.
  3. The company plans to use the net issue proceeds for expanding its pick & carry cranes manufacturing capacity, repayment of borrowings, investment in its NBFC subsidiary, and general corporate purposes.
  4. Analysts have given mixed ratings to the IPO, with some recommending a 'subscribe' for long-term investment and others citing high valuation.
"The company is priced at a P/E ratio of 65x times which is fully priced. Therefore, we believe that the Indo Farm with traditional business value and experienced promoters and well planned capacity expansion, debt repayment and strengthening of financial arm are expected to be capitalising over the long run." - Anand Rathi

The issue received strong demand on the first day, with the portion reserved for retail investors being subscribed the highest. The bidding process will continue until January 2, 2025.

item.title: Hyundai India Records All-Time High Annual Sales Of Over 6 Lakh Units In 2024 - NDTV
item.description:
Hyundai India Achieves Record Annual Sales of Over 6 Lakh Units in 2024

Publication Date: 2024

Source: Hyundai Motor India Limited

Hyundai Motor India Limited (HMIL) recorded its highest-ever yearly domestic sales of 6,05,433 units in CY 2024, achieving a total sales of 7,64,119 units including exports.

  • HMIL reported total monthly sales of 55,078 units in December 2024.
  • The introduction of the innovative Hy-CNG Duo technology contributed to a 13.1% CNG share in domestic sales.
  • The Hyundai CRETA was a standout model with sales of 1,86,919 units, representing significant SUV leadership.
  • Hyundai's SUVs accounted for 67.6% of total domestic sales in 2024.
“HMIL has managed to sustain sales momentum in 2024, despite strong headwinds faced by the industry at large.” – Mr. Tarun Garg, Whole-time Director and Chief Operating Officer

This record achievement in sales underscores Hyundai's strong market position and customer preference for its vehicles, especially in the SUV segment.

item.title: Brawl over biryani at restaurants in Hyderabad on New Year's Eve - The Siasat Daily
item.description:
Brawl Erupts Over Biryani at Hyderabad Restaurants on New Year's Eve

Date & Source: January 1, 2025, The Siasat Daily

Chaos unfolded outside restaurants in Hyderabad’s LB Nagar and Secunderabad as customers and delivery agents brawled over biryani, disrupting festive celebrations.

  • Customers and delivery personnel clashed as tensions rose over biryani orders.
  • The physical altercation led to a temporary halt in services at local restaurants.
  • According to Swiggy’s report, Hyderabad topped biryani orders with 9.7 million requests in 2024.
  • Local authorities are investigating the incident for future crowd management.
“Chaos unfolded outside restaurants in Hyderabad's LB Nagar and Secunderabad on New Year's Eve as customers and delivery agents brawled over their beloved biryani.” — The Siasat Daily

The incident highlights the intense demand for biryani in Hyderabad, raising concerns over crowd control during peak dining times.

item.title: HDFC Bank To Indian Hotels: Motilal Oswal Shares Large, Mid And Small-Cap Picks For 2025 - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Motilal Oswal's Stock Picks for 2025: HDFC Bank, Bharti Airtel, and More

Date: 01 Jan 2025 | Source: NDTV Profit

Motilal Oswal Financial Services has outlined its top stock picks for 2025, focusing on a mix of large, mid, and small-cap companies amidst a cautiously optimistic outlook for the Indian equity market.

  • Motilal Oswal is optimistic about sectors including IT, healthcare, banking, and financial services.
  • The brokerage recommends large-cap stocks like HDFC Bank, Bharti Airtel, and Larsen & Toubro.
  • In the mid and small-cap ranges, recommended stocks include Indian Hotels, Coforge, and Godrej Properties.
  • The NSE Nifty 50 index had a lower return in 2024 compared to previous years.
  • Recovery is anticipated in 2025 due to increased government spending and improved rural incomes.
"Notably, Nifty-50’s EPS CAGR of 17% over FY20-25E has been higher while the index CAGR was 14% during the last five years." - Motilal Oswal

The outlook for 2025 suggests possible alleviation of concerns regarding earnings and consumption, despite anticipated challenges in global trade and inflation.

item.title: Nippon Life India MF investors lost over Rs 1,800 crore due to Yes Bank AT-1 bond exposure, says Sebi - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Investors Lose Over Rs 1,800 Crore Due to Yes Bank AT-1 Bond Exposure, Says Sebi

Date: January 01, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The article discusses the significant losses faced by investors of Nippon Life India Mutual Fund due to exposure to Yes Bank's AT-1 bonds, which were fully written down. Sebi has alleged a quid pro quo in the management fees earned by the fund.

  • Investors lost nearly Rs 1,830 crore on AT-1 bonds from Yes Bank.
  • Sebi is investigating allegations of improper financial arrangements between Nippon Life India MF and Yes Bank.
  • The fund house earned Rs 88.60 crore in management fees amid the losses.
  • A broader multi-agency investigation is ongoing regarding the involvement of Reliance Capital and associated companies.
Sebi has sought an explanation as to why the management fee should not be disgorged and considers debarment for an 'appropriate period'.

This situation underscores the complexities in financial investments and the regulatory scrutiny that follows significant losses.

item.title: Sensex jumps over 600 points: 2 reasons why stock market is rising today - India Today
item.description:
Sensex jumps over 600 points: 2 reasons why stock market is rising today

Date: Jan 1, 2025

Source: India Today

The stock market opened flat but rallied significantly in the afternoon session, with the Sensex gaining over 600 points fueled by positive auto sales data and strong performances across several sectors.

  • The S&P BSE Sensex was up 470.08 points to 78,609.09 and Nifty50 added 138.85 points to 23,783.65.
  • 2,566 stocks gained on the BSE, while 1,238 declined during the session.
  • 128 stocks reached their 52-week highs, indicating robust market activity.
  • Strong auto sales contributed significantly to the market's upward momentum.
“In December 2024, Maruti Suzuki India Limited sold a total of 178,248 units...,” said Maruti Suzuki in a press release.

Overall, the market showed significant gains across multiple sectors, indicating a strong start to the year for investors.

item.title: Stock to buy: After eroding 55% of investor wealth in 2024, Vodafone Idea could rise 64%, suggests Citi's target price | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Stock to buy: After eroding 55% of investor wealth in 2024, Vodafone Idea could rise 64%, suggests Citi’s target price

Publication Date: 2024-XX-XX Source: LiveMint

Vodafone Idea shares have seen a significant drop in 2024, yet Citi has upgraded the stock to 'buy' with a target price of ₹13, suggesting a 64% upside. The upgrade follows the government's approval of a bank guarantee waiver for spectrum payments, providing much-needed relief for the financially struggling telecom operator.

  1. Vodafone Idea's stock lost nearly 50% of its value in 2024.
  2. Citi has set a target price of ₹13, indicating a potential increase of 64% from its last closing price.
  3. The Department of Telecommunications waived bank guarantees for significant spectrum dues.
  4. This waiver is seen as a major relief, addressing a critical funding hurdle for the telecom operator.
  5. The waiver will also positively impact related entities like Indus Towers.
  6. Vodafone Idea's shares are currently valued at ₹7.94, significantly below their 52-week high.
  7. The firm continues to face challenges from outstanding payments related to past spectrum auctions.
“This step of bank guarantee waiver is a clear indication of the government's continued support to the telecom industry.” - Vodafone Idea

The bank guarantee waiver signifies a pivotal moment for Vodafone Idea, though securing further debt funding remains crucial for its recovery and broader telecom sector implications.

item.title: Hyundai Motor India December sales down 2.4 pc at 55,078 units - The Economic Times
item.description:
Hyundai Motor India December Sales Decline 2.4% to 55,078 Units

Last Updated: Jan 01, 2025, 02:36 PM IST Source: PTI

Hyundai Motor India Ltd reported a 2.4% decline in total sales for December 2024, with 55,078 units sold compared to 56,450 units in December 2023. Nevertheless, the company achieved its highest-ever yearly domestic sales in 2024.

  • December total sales: 55,078 units, down 2.4% YoY.
  • Domestic sales for December: 42,208 units, down 1.3% YoY.
  • Exports in December: 12,870 units, down 6.1% YoY.
  • Record yearly domestic sales: 6,05,433 units in 2024.
  • SUV contribution to total sales: 67.6% in 2024.
"Achieving highest-ever domestic sales three years in a row reflects customers' preference for brand Hyundai as their trusted smart mobility solutions provider," said Tarun Garg, HMIL Whole-time Director and COO.

The overall sales in 2024 were marginally lower at 7,64,119 units compared to 7,65,786 units in 2023.

item.title: Maruti Suzuki shares surge after December sales increase by 30% - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Maruti Suzuki's Sales Surge and Price Hike Plans Boost Stock

Published on: March 15, 2025, Source: CNBC-TV18

Maruti Suzuki India Ltd.'s shares rose on January 1 after the company reported a 29.6% year-on-year increase in total sales for December, exceeding analyst expectations. The company sold 1.78 lakh units compared to 1.37 lakh units in the same period last year. Domestic sales rose 27.3% to 1.41 lakh units, while exports increased by 39.2% to 37,419 units.

Maruti Suzuki also announced plans to increase car prices by up to 4% starting January 2025 due to rising input costs and operational expenses. Despite the price hike announcement, the company's stock traded 2.78% higher at ₹11,160.05. In the past year, Maruti Suzuki's shares have risen nearly 9%.

item.title: Not Shimla or Manali, OYO’s Ritesh Agarwal surprised by the hill stations that took the lead in New Year b - The Economic Times
item.description:
OYO's Ritesh Agarwal Highlights Surprising Trends in New Year Travel Bookings

Publication Date: January 1, 2025 | Source: OYO News

As New Year 2025 celebrations unfolded, OYO Rooms founder Ritesh Agarwal shared insights on surprising trends in travel bookings, highlighting a surge in lesser-known hill stations and spiritual destinations.

A Surge in Underdog Hill Stations

Agarwal noted that locations often considered underdogs saw substantial increases in bookings:

  • Coorg witnessed a 28x surge this New Year.
  • Mussoorie recorded a 10x rise in bookings.
“Dehradun & Srinagar become the most booked hill stations, but the underdogs are stealing the show!” — Ritesh Agarwal

Spiritual Destinations Gain Popularity

Agarwal observed a notable increase in bookings for spiritual destinations:

  • Banaras (Varanasi) was the most popular with 12,841 bookings.
  • Ayodhya became a new entrant in the top charts, expected to rise further.
“The growing demand for spiritual travel demonstrates a shift towards destinations that offer both cultural and religious experiences.” — Ritesh Agarwal

Record Bookings and Late-Night Traffic Spikes

Over 10 lakh people used OYO Rooms worldwide on New Year's Eve, a 58% increase compared to 2023. Agarwal said, “It’s clear the world is ready to celebrate.” Additionally, a 41% increase in late-night website traffic was reported.

Financial Performance and Growth Trajectory

The company reported a net profit of ₹132 crore for the first quarter of FY25, marking a turnaround from the previous year's loss. This was bolstered by the recent acquisition of G6 Hospitality, expected to drive future growth.

Conclusion

OYO Rooms has begun 2025 with robust growth in both leisure and spiritual travel destinations, positioning itself for continued success in the evolving hospitality market.
